page.title: 01Swaffham Heath, Norfolk
page.content: An area of gently rolling forest and farmland, between 65 and 15 metres above sea level. Soil is light and sandy, on chalk, with much flint. Rain drains quickly and this coupled with persistent winds has meant that before modern fertilisers agricuture was unrewarding. and led to nearly half the landscape being planted with conifers by the Forestry Commission. Four small farms lie within the area, and other dwellings, built for Foresters lie along the one metalled road running from Swaffham to Beachmwell. The area has many tracks and public rights of way, though some plantations are closed because of shooting rights. Besides pheasants and French partridge, wildlife includes goldcrests, golden pheasants, crossbills, nightjars, owls, roe deer, hares,rabbits, grey and red squirrels.
